ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install mysql-server fi

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

service-version.name: BitNami Liferay
service-version.description:
BitNami Liferay Stack greatly simplifies the deployment of Liferay and its required dependencies.
Liferay is a leading open source portal, web content management and collaboration software package. Liferay includes an extensive set of capabilities within a single easy to use package. Portal platforms make it easy for users to build web pages and websites by combining a theme, a set of pages with portlets/gadgets/content, and navigation and making it available based on a set of user groups/orgs/roles. Liferay’s included web content management makes it a popular tool for building and managing content requiring workflow approvals for updated content. Additionally, Liferay includes many out-of-the-box social collaboration features such as a doc library, off-line document sync, internal messaging, online presence, chat, wiki server, blog server, forums server with additional support for CMIS and OpenSocial. Also supports social collaboration features such as a friend network, activity streams and more.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
### BitNami Liferay Service INSTALL script ###
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin
APP_NAME=liferay APP_VERSION=6.1.1-0
if [ -x /usr/sbin/setenforce ]; then /usr/sbin/setenforce 0 fi
echo "Installing BitNami common packages.." yum --nogpgcheck -y clean all yum --nogpgcheck -y install mysql
echo "Downloading BitNami packages.." platform=`uname -m`
cd /tmp
if [ $platform == "i686" ]; then echo "32 bit" wget ${download_url}/bitnami-$APP_NAME-$APP_VERSION-linux-installer.run else echo "64 bit" wget ${download_url}/bitnami-$APP_NAME-$APP_VERSION-linux-x64-installer.run fi
chmod 755 bitnami-*
echo "OK!"

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
### BitNami Liferay Service CONFIGURE script ###
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin
cd /tmp echo "Configuring BitNami Liferay.." echo "login: ${liferay_user}@liferay.com"
./bitnami-liferay* --mode unattended --prefix /opt/bitnami --base_password ${mysql_password} --mysql_installation_type existing --mysql_binary_directory /usr/bin --mysql_client_hostname "${mysql_client_hostname}" --mysql_hostname ${mysql_hostname} --mysql_port ${mysql_port} --base_user ${liferay_user} --liferay_password ${liferay_password} --base_user_name "${liferay_user_name}"
rm bitnami-liferay* echo "OK!"
